text: Prepare the slow cooker. Insert your non-stick lining bag or spray the insides with a light and thin layer of non-stick cooking spray. Add the ingredients. Combine the potatoes, onion, celery, chicken broth, and celery seeds into the slow cooker. Set the slow cooker on. Place the slow cooker on high for 3 to 4 hours. Make the thickening paste. Mix the cornstarch and milk together in a small bowl. Add the paste to the slow cooker. Drizzle the mixture slowly around, in the last 20 minutes of cooking. Fold in the paste into the mixture and re-cover the slow cooker. Serve the chowder. Sprinkle salt and pepper, to taste, and serve in individual bowls.
